CatDescriptText: D.E. Smith, president Oliver Shops Inc., Squirrel Hill and Nathaniel Edmonds, Garfield were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 32 with question: "Do you favor pari-mutuel harness racing in Pennsylvania?" Mr. Smith's answer reads: "Yes, because it may reduce taxes.  Also, there is money going out of the state for the same purpose.  It might as well be kept here."  Mr. Edmond's answer reads: "Indeed so, because the county and the city will receive more revenue.  It might cut taxes."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of D.E. Smith wearing patterned necktie with clip and plaid jacket, standing in front of Faber, Coe, and Gregg, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Nathaniel Edmonds wearing People's Cab cap and moustache, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
